conStatus.toolTip: Could not establish direct connection and is currently being Relayed through zerotier servers with higher latency

welcomeMessage.slogan: ZeroTier VPN lets you connect your devices securely and privately across the internet, no matter where you are. Enjoy fast and reliable connections without the usual barriers, keeping your data safe and accessible.

forgot.forgotPasswordMessage: We will send you a reset link if the account exists

mfaRecovery.mfaRecoveryMessage: We will send you instructions on how to recover your account

mfaRecoveryReset.mfaRecoveryResetMessage: Please enter your credentials and Recovery Code

emailVerification.errorMessage: An error occurred while verifying your email.
emailVerification.successMessage: Your email has been successfully verified.
emailVerification.redirectMessage: You will be redirected automatically in {seconds} seconds.

networks.title: Networks

unlinkedNetworks.title: There is {amount} unassigned network registered with the controller.

networks.noNetworksMessage: No networks have been created yet. Start by creating one and it will appear here.

moveNetwork.title: Move network
moveNetwork.description: You can locate the ID in the organization URL.
moveNetwork.warningText:
Warning: Transferring the network will move both the network and its members to the selected organization. This action is irreversible and cannot be undone. Please confirm the organization ID carefully before proceeding.

Additionally, ensure you have write permissions to the organization to which you are transferring the network.

deleteNetwork.title: Delete network
deleteNetwork.description: Deleting a network will permanently remove it along with all its associated data.
deleteNetwork.warningText: Warning: This action will irreversibly delete the network and all related members, settings, and data. This process cannot be undone. Please ensure you have backed up any necessary information before proceeding with deletion.

errorSteps.step1: Verify that the ZeroTier container is operational
errorSteps.step2: If other instances of ZeroTier are active locally, please deactivate them as it might cause conflicts.

noMembersInformation.title: This network has no members, see installation instructions below

networkMembersAlert.message: Join this network ID and the device will automatically be displayed

deleteNetwork.title: Delete network {networkName}
deleteNetwork.description: Are you sure you want to delete this network? This cannot be undone and all members will be deleted from this network

privatePublicSwitch.privateCardContent: Each user needs to be authorized by the network administrator.
privatePublicSwitch.publicCardContent: All users can connect to this network without Autorization

duplicateIpNotification.title: {count} other network(s) have been found with the same subnet.

modal.title: Duplicate subnet detected
modal.description: The following networks have the same subnet as the current network ({name}). This may not be an issue, but if you connect both networks from the same PC, it could cause IP address conflicts and connectivity problems.

ipv4.please_enter_valid_ip_range: Please enter a valid IP range

mtu.title: MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit)
mtu.description: This setting determines the largest packet size that can be transmitted through the network. Adjusting the MTU value can impact network performance and efficiency.

networkRoutes.noManagedRoutesDescription1: Devices will not get an IP address without a matching route.
networkRoutes.noManagedRoutesDescription2: If you do not have specific requirements, try the IPv4 Auto-Assign Easy mode.
networkRoutes.destinationInputDescription: Enter the destination network address in CIDR notation
networkRoutes.viaInputDescription: Enter the via IP address of the next hop. Leave empty to target local LAN

inviteMemberByMail.title: Mail
inviteMemberByMail.successMessage: Success! An invitation email has been sent to {email}

addMemberById.labelText: Manually Add Member. Can be used to undelete a member.

handleSumbit.errorNotValidIp: IP {target} is not a valid IP address

ipAssignment.description: Add or remove an IP address for this member.

allowEthernetBridging.description: Bridging requires additional setup on the device. See manual and knowledgebase for more information. Mobile devices cannot be bridges.

doNotAutoAssignIPs.description: This will disable the ability to automatically assign IP addresses to this member.

anotation.description: Enhance your member organization by adding notations

networkHelp.title: Network Help
networkHelp.networkIDText: The network's globally unique 16-digit ID. This cannot currently be changed.
networkHelp.networkNameText: A user-defined short name for this network that is visible to members. We recommend using something like a domain name (e.g., zerotier.com) or an email address.
networkHelp.accessControlText: How is membership controlled? This should be left on its default setting unless you want to create a totally open network for testing, gaming, etc.
networkHelp.multicastRecipientLimitText: The maximum number of recipients that can receive an Ethernet multicast or broadcast. If the number of recipients exceeds this limit, a random subset will receive the announcement. Setting this higher makes multicasts more reliable on large networks at the expense of bandwidth.
networkHelp.multicastRecipientLimitText2: Setting to 0 disables multicast, but be aware that only IPv6 with NDP emulation (RFC4193 or 6PLANE addressing modes) or other unicast-only protocols will work without multicast.
networkHelp.managedRoutesText: IPv4 routes to be published to network members. This can be used to create routes to other networks via gateways on a ZeroTier network. Note that for security reasons most clients will not use default routes or routes that overlap with public IP address space unless this is specifically allowed by the user. Public IP ranges are marked with an icon:
networkHelp.ipv4AutoAssignText: IPv4 range from which to auto-assign IPs. Note that IPs will only be assigned if they also fall within a defined route. Easy mode allows users to pick an IP range and a route and pool definition will automatically be created.
networkHelp.dnsPushText2: Older versions of ZeroTier will ignore these settings.
networkHelp.dnsPushText3: On macOS, iOS, Windows, and Android, ZeroTier can automatically add DNS servers for a specific domain. It does not set up or host a DNS server. You must host your own.
networkHelp.dnsPushText4: If you configure zt.example.com as your search domain, and 10.147.20.1 as a server address, then your computer will ask 10.147.20.1 to look up IP addresses for hostnames ending in zt.example.com.
networkHelp.dnsPushText5: This must be enabled on each client with the allowDNS option. There is a checkbox in the UI in each network's details, near the Allow Managed checkbox.

application.title: Application
application.description: Customize the application's appearance and behavior to better align with your brand

publicPages.description: Customize the text displayed on your login and registration pages to better align with your brand or provide specific instructions to your users.

mail.smtpRequireTLSDescription: Enforce valid SSL/TLS certificates. Disable only if using self-signed certificates.

authentication.enableUserRegistrationDescription: This will allow users to click the Sign-Up button at the landing page.

generateInvitation.secretMessageLabel: User will be asked to enter this message upon registration (Case sensitive)
generateInvitation.expireTimeLabel: Invitation link will expire after this time
generateInvitation.timeUsedLabel: How many times can this link be used? (Optional, default 1)

users.description: All registered users on the platform.

account.title: ZTNet performs a daily check for expired users. If a user is found to be expired, all associated peers will be de-authorized, and the user's account will be deactivated.

userOptionModal.typeUserName: Type the name of the user.

toast.nameNotEqual: The username you entered is not the same as the user.

roleDescriptions.admin: As an admin, this user will have full permissions, including access to the admin panel.
roleDescriptions.user: If set to User, this user will have limited permissions and will not be able to access the admin panel.

groups.description: Create a new user group to better organize platform users. Assigning users to specific groups allows for controlled access, setting of limits, and adjusting settings based on user types.

addGroup.deleteGroupDescription: Are you sure you want to delete this group? If assigned, it will be removed from the user.
addGroup.groupNameDescription: Enter a name for the new group
addGroup.networkLimitDescription: Set the maximum number of networks that can be created by users in this group
addGroup.useAsDefaultDescription: Set this group as the default group for new users

unlinkedNetworks.title: Unlinked Networks
unlinkedNetworks.description: This section provides a table of all networks that are not currently linked to any user in the ztnet database. These typically originate from custom ZeroTier controllers that have been added by users but are not yet managed within ZTNET. The table gives you the opportunity to assign these unmanaged networks to specific admin users. This can be particularly helpful if a user has added a custom ZeroTier controller that hasn't been managed by ZTNET yet.

assignModal.title: Are you sure you want to assign user {user} to network {network}?

controllerConfig.modification_warning: Modifying the ZeroTier controller URL affects all users. While this offers flexibility for those wanting a custom controller, be aware of potential disruptions and compatibility issues. Always backup configurations before changes.
controllerConfig.submit_empty_field_default: Submit empty field to use the default.
controllerConfig.isUsingEnvVariablesAlert: The ZT_ADDR or ZT_SECRET environment variable takes precedence and overrides any URL changes made through the UI. To update the respective fields via the UI, you must first remove the ZT_ADDR or ZT_SECRET environment variables.

generatePlanet.updatePlanetWarning: Updating the planet file will modify the core structure of your ZeroTier network, impacting routes, flexibility, and potentially availability. Proceed with caution, understanding the implications.
generatePlanet.customPlanetInUse: Custom Planet is currently in use!
generatePlanet.customPortIsInUseDescription: You need to add <kbd>ZT_PRIMARY_PORT:port</kbd> to the ZeroTier Docker Compose environment variables.
generatePlanet.downloadPlanetInfo: Should you need it, the planet file is available for download at the following URL:
generatePlanet.generatePrivateRootPlaceholder: Add a private root to your controller
generatePlanet.commentDescription: Add a comment for this planet (optionally)
generatePlanet.identityDescription: Identity (optionally). Default value is the content of current identity.public
generatePlanet.endpointsDescription: Enter the external IP address of your controller. Use a comma-separated format (IP/PORT) for multiple addresses. For example: '84.17.53.155/9993,2a02:6ea0:d405::/9993'. Ensure these addresses are globally reachable if you want nodes outside your local network to connect.

modal.restartContainerInstructions:
You will need to restart zerotier container to load the new configuration:



docker restart zerotier
modal.restoreOriginalPlanetContent: Are you sure you want to restore the original planet file? Make sure to backup your current planet file if you want to keep the current keys

addOrganization.title: Team Management
addOrganization.description: Explore the Organization to begin shaping the way your team works together. Assign roles, invite new members, and oversee basic permissions within your organization. Designed for simplicity and ease of use, this beta feature provides a foundation for your team's collaboration. As we continue to develop and enhance these settings, we invite you to provide feedback to help us refine the experience.

deleteOrganizationModal.title: Delete Organization
deleteOrganizationModal.description: Are you sure you want to delete this organization?
deleteOrganizationModal.description2: This action will permanently delete the organization along with all its networks, members, and related data. This action cannot be undone.
deleteOrganizationModal.confirmation: Please confirm that you want to proceed with deleting the organization.

organizationName.placeholder: Type the name of the organization to confirm

totp.title: Two Factor Authentication
totp.description: This will enhance the security of user accounts by requiring an additional verification step.
totp.mfaNote: Note: 2FA will only work if you sign in with credentials. OAuth will not use this 2FA, even if configured, as it is managed by the OAuth provider.

notification.title: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) Not Enabled
notification.description: We strongly recommend enabling 2FA to enhance your account security.

displayQrCode.description: Do you need a two-factor authentication app? Download one of the following
displayQrCode.appDescription: These apps are recommended, but other authentication apps will also work.
displayQrCode.scanQrDescription: Scan this QR code with your authenticator app.
displayQrCode.manualEntry: If you can't scan the QR code, you can manually enter the following:

enterTotpCode.enterCode: Enter the code from your authenticator app to verify and enable TOTP.

restapi.description: This allows you to generate an API token that you can use to authenticate and gain access to our application's API services. With a valid token, you can make requests to the API and interact with the application's features programmatically.

tokenName.label: Add a meaningful name to your token

response.title: Click the token to Copy
response.info: This token will only be shown once. Please copy it now!

deleteToken.title: Delete Token
deleteToken.description: Are you sure you want to delete this token? This cannot be undone.

zerotierCentral.title: Zerotier Central
zerotierCentral.description:
Incorporating your ZeroTier Central API will enable you to manage your central networks directly from ZTNET. Upon integrating the key, a new menu will appear in the sidebar for enhanced accessibility and control.

You can obtain a key from the ZeroTier Central portal. https://my.zerotier.com/account
zerotierCentral.apiUrlLabelDescription: The url of the ZeroTier Central API, Default is https://api.zerotier.com/api/v1

annotations.showMarkerInTableDescription:
This will add a circle before the the member name with the anotation color.

You can still search the anotation if disabled.
annotations.addBackgroundColorInTableDescription:
This will add row background color based on the anotation color.

You can still search the anotation if disabled.

memberTable.deAuthorizationWarningLabel: Display a confirmation modal to prevent accidental de-authorizations.
memberTable.addMemberIdAsNameTitle: Add the member ID as name uppon registration
memberTable.addMemberIdAsNameLabel: When a network member registers, the member ID (nodeid) will be added as name.

newDeviceLogin.title: New device login alert
newDeviceLogin.description: Receive an email when a new device signs in to your account for the first time.

ipAddressChange.title: IP address change alert
ipAddressChange.description: Receive an email when a known device accesses your account from a new IP address.

errors.getOrgError: Contact organization admin to make sure you have proper permissions

leaveOrganization.confirmationMessage: Are you sure you want to leave the organization?
leaveOrganization.note: Note: If you decide to rejoin this organization in the future, an admin will need to send you a new invitation.

chatSidebar.chatInfo: Everyone in the Organization will be able to see your message.

invitation.title: Team Expansion: Invite New Members
invitation.description:
Invite more people to your team! You can send invitations by email or find and add people who are already using the platform.

This makes it easy for your team to grow and include more members.

inviteByEmail.title: Invite by Email
inviteByEmail.description: Invited users who are not currently members of the application will need to register through the provided link in the invitation email. Link is valid for 24 hour.
inviteByEmail.emailDescription: Enter the email address of the person you want to invite
inviteByEmail.selectRoleDescription: Select the role of the user

inviteSiteUser.title: Invite site users
inviteSiteUser.description: Before you can add users to your organization, it's important to note that they must already be registered in the application

searchUser.title: Search the user you want to add

userRole.title: Select the role of the user

globalNodeNaming.title: Enable global node naming
globalNodeNaming.bulletPoints:
Maintain a consistent name for each node across all networks in the organization.
Update the node's name in all networks when you rename it in one network.
Upon member registration, check if the member exists in your organization and use the first name found.
globalNodeNaming.note: Note: This is applicable exclusively to networks within this particular organization.

webhook.title: Organization Webhooks
webhook.description:
Empower your organization with our webhook integration, offering real-time notifications for critical events.

Stay ahead with instant updates, directly piped into your system, ensuring seamless workflow and immediate response capabilities.

createWebhook.webhookNameDescription: This field is for entering the name of the webhook. The name is used to identify the webhook and should be descriptive enough to distinguish it from other webhooks.
createWebhook.selectWebhookActionsDescription: This dropdown menu allows you to choose the specific actions your webhook should perform. Each option represents a different type of action.
createWebhook.webhookUrlDescription: This field is for entering the URL where the webhook will send data. It must be a valid and accessible URL endpoint that can receive and process incoming webhook data.
